items.name: Adult Trauma Bag
items.searchText: adult trauma bag trauma back first in first end bag red orange
items.description: Contains all trauma supplies for adult patients
items.notes: Red tag = inventory tracking. If seal unbroken, contents unchanged.
locationSteps: Step 1: Go to OUTSIDE of ambulance (driver's side)
Step 2: Find Cabinet K - main side compartment door
Step 3: Open Middle Drawer - trauma bag is in FRONT
Step 4: Grab RED/ORANGE bag - this is the adult trauma bag
items.quickFind: Outside ambulance → Cabinet K (side door) → Middle drawer → RED bag in front

items.name: Adult Oxygen Kit
items.searchText: adult oxygen kit O2 green bag respiratory oral nasal airways masks tank
items.location: Cabinet K - Middle Drawer (BEHIND trauma bag)
items.description: Complete respiratory treatment kit with oxygen tank inside
items.contents: Oral airways, nasal airways, oxygen masks, oxygen tank

items.name: Pediatric Oxygen Kit
items.searchText: pediatric peds child kids oxygen O2 kit blue respiratory
items.location: Cabinet K - Lower Drawer (FRONT - oxygen first for kids!)
items.description: Pediatric respiratory kit - placed FIRST because children primarily have respiratory emergencies
items.notes: Kids rarely have cardiac problems - respiratory is primary concern. Oxygen for children is PRIMARY importance.

items.name: Pediatric Trauma Bag
items.searchText: pediatric peds child kids trauma bag first in blue ferno
items.location: Cabinet K - Lower Drawer (BEHIND oxygen kit)
items.description: Pediatric trauma supplies

items.name: Intubation Kit
items.searchText: intubation kit airway bag tube advanced airway labeled
items.description: Complete intubation equipment for advanced airway management

items.name: IV Kit
items.searchText: IV kit intravenous access supplies bag medication drug administration
items.description: Everything to establish IV access - primarily for paramedic drug administration

items.name: Portable AED
items.searchText: AED defibrillator defib automated external portable cardiac arrest heart black yellow green
items.color: BLACK bag with RED 'AED' lettering, YELLOW-GREEN reflective strip
items.description: Automated External Defibrillator for cardiac emergencies
items.notes: Check for GREEN FLASH every 8-10 seconds = charged and ready
locationSteps: Step 1: Go to OUTSIDE of ambulance (driver's side)
Step 2: Find Cabinet K - main side compartment door
Step 3: Open cabinet - AED is on TOP SHELF (further back)
Step 4: Look for BLACK bag with RED 'AED' lettering
items.quickFind: Outside ambulance → Cabinet K (side door) → Top shelf (back) → BLACK bag with RED AED letters

items.name: Drug Box
items.searchText: drug box orange medication meds acetaminophen magnesium sulfate non-controlled
items.location: Cabinet J (above Cabinet K, inside ambulance)
items.description: Contains non-controlled drugs: acetaminophen, magnesium sulfate, etc.
items.driverNote: ORANGE BOX = DRUG BOX. That's all you need to know.
locationSteps: Step 1: Enter patient compartment through side door
Step 2: Find Cabinet J - located ABOVE Cabinet K, inside
Step 3: Open cabinet - look for ORANGE box
Step 4: Grab the ORANGE BOX - that's the Drug Box
items.quickFind: Inside ambulance → Cabinet J (above K) → ORANGE box

items.name: Portable Suction
items.searchText: portable suction battery scene suctioning unit
items.description: Battery-operated suction for on-scene use
items.warning: CRITICAL: Cord plugged into cigarette lighter at back of cabinet. MUST UNPLUG before removing! Does NOT detach at unit. Like pulling away from gas pump with nozzle in tank!
items.notes: One of THREE suction types on board
locationSteps: Step 1: Enter patient compartment through side door
Step 2: Find Cabinet J - located ABOVE Cabinet K, inside
Step 3: BEFORE grabbing - locate power cord at back of cabinet
Step 4: UNPLUG cord from cigarette lighter FIRST
Step 5: Then remove suction unit
items.quickFind: Inside ambulance → Cabinet J (above K) → UNPLUG FIRST, then grab unit

items.name: Glucometer
items.searchText: glucometer glucose meter blood sugar diabetic diabetes black pouch
items.location: Drawer N - Always in exact same spot
items.description: Checks blood glucose levels in diabetic patients
items.driverNote: Little black box, little black pouch - always in same spot
locationSteps: Step 1: Enter patient compartment through side door
Step 2: Look for Drawer N - located on left wall
Step 3: Open drawer - Glucometer always in SAME spot
Step 4: Grab small BLACK box/pouch
items.quickFind: Inside ambulance → Drawer N (left wall) → Small black box/pouch

items.name: Narcan
items.searchText: narcan naloxone opioid overdose reversal medication nasal atomizer syringe
items.location: Drawer N - readily accessible, 3 on board
items.description: Opioid overdose reversal medication - delivered intranasally
items.warning: CRITICAL: Nasal ATOMIZER must come with syringe - they are TAPED TOGETHER. Syringe alone is useless! Atomizer screws onto syringe tip.
items.notes: Old packaging: orange container. New packaging: clear tube (can see syringe). Additional Narcan in Drug Box but Drawer N is fastest.
locationSteps: Step 1: Enter patient compartment through side door
Step 2: Look for Drawer N - located on left wall
Step 3: Open drawer - Narcan in clear tubes or orange containers
Step 4: GRAB BOTH syringe AND atomizer (taped together)
items.quickFind: Inside ambulance → Drawer N (left wall) → Clear tubes or orange containers

items.name: Spare Oxygen Tanks
items.searchText: spare oxygen O2 tanks bottles cylinders backup extra matheson green aluminum
items.location: Next to steps on side entry of ambulance
items.description: 2 spare tanks in holder, plus 1 each in adult and pediatric oxygen kits (4 total)
items.warning: SQUEEZE brackets together to release tank (counterintuitive). At 15 L/min, tank only lasts few minutes.
items.notes: New Matheson tanks: green top, aluminum, single valve operation. Old steel tanks: two-step process - open valve first, then set flow.
locationSteps: Step 1: Go to SIDE of ambulance
Step 2: Find side entry door (with steps)
Step 3: Look NEXT TO the steps - tanks are in holder
Step 4: SQUEEZE brackets together to release tank
items.quickFind: Side of ambulance → Next to entry steps → SQUEEZE brackets to release

items.name: LifePak 15
items.searchText: lifepak life pack 15 monitor cardiac vitals EKG pulse ox blood pressure expensive
items.location: Mounted position in patient compartment - obvious location
items.description: Cardiac monitor/defibrillator - $42,000-$62,000 - HANDLE WITH CARE
items.driverNote: Press GREEN button ONCE briefly when requested to turn on. Do NOT shut off after hospital - EMT needs code summary printout.
items.notes: Carry with sensitive side (screen) against body. Has extra BP cuffs and batteries on other side. Must press AND HOLD to shut off (prevents accidental shutdown).
locationSteps: Step 1: Enter patient compartment through side door
Step 2: Look for mounted unit - obvious location on wall
Step 3: Press GREEN button ONCE briefly to turn on
Step 4: Carry with screen facing your body (protect it)
items.quickFind: Inside ambulance → Mounted on wall → Press GREEN button to turn on

items.name: LUCAS Device
items.searchText: lucas device CPR machine mechanical automatic chest compressions MC2
items.location: MC2 back seat - secured with seatbelt only
items.description: Mechanical CPR device - delivers consistent chest compressions
items.notes: Hit seatbelt release to access. Purchased by Town of Harpswell. MC2 carries it because they're usually first on scene (OBI is 23 minutes away).

items.name: Saline Bags
items.searchText: saline bags IV fluid normal NS solution hydration warm heated
items.description: IV fluid for hydration - moved from K for easier access
items.warning: MUST grab PRIMARY SET (IV tubing) with saline bag - bag is USELESS without tubing!
items.notes: Warm saline in heated IV warmer during winter for hypothermic patients. Cabinet doors fold DOWN for easier access.

items.name: Primary Sets
items.searchText: primary sets IV tubing administration drip line saline
items.location: Cabinet D - right next to saline bags
items.description: IV tubing with needle for saline bags - required to administer saline

items.name: Onboard Suction
items.searchText: onboard main built-in vacuum suction stretcher transport
items.location: Built into patient compartment - wall-mounted unit
items.description: Vacuum pump driven suction for patients on stretcher during transport
items.notes: Wall-mounted in patient compartment. Always available when patient is on stretcher.
locationSteps: Step 1: Enter patient compartment
Step 2: Look at LEFT WALL near head of stretcher
Step 3: Wall-mounted suction unit with green components
Step 4: Already connected - ready to use
items.quickFind: Inside ambulance → Left wall → Green wall-mounted unit
